channel.title: I require help. x blitz x, I reposted!
channel.description:
Yes, I know this isn't the request section because there isn't one. So this seemed the most logical place to write this. Well, as some of you may know, Shamon King released a clean source that has these features in it:
[b]Features:[/b] - logging in - equipping - rendering - walking/running - saving - loading - logging out [b]End of Features[/b]
The only problem is though, she uses Apache Ant to run her server and I have no idea how to remove it. So, if anyone could remove it for me so it'll work, that'd be great. If you can create one like hers but without the Apache Ant, that'd also be great. Thanks guys.

item.title: I require help. x blitz x, I reposted!
item.dc:creator: @99skiller99 99skiller99
item.description:
@99skiller99 wrote:

I did that and re-did all that, so now it’s this.

BlakeScape Server: Exception!
java.net.SocketException: Software caused connection abort: socket write error
        at java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite0(Native Method)
        at java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite(Unknown Source)
        at java.net.SocketOutputStream.write(Unknown Source)
        at Client.parseOutgoingPackets(Client.java:769)
        at Client.packetProcess(Client.java:720)
        at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:196)
        at Server.main(Server.java:50)

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @99skiller99 99skiller99
item.description:
@99skiller99 wrote:

Now the char files don’t save.

BlakeScape Server: Exception!
java.net.SocketException: Software caused connection abort: socket write error
        at java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite0(Native Method)
        at java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite(Unknown Source)
        at java.net.SocketOutputStream.write(Unknown Source)
        at Client.parseOutgoingPackets(Client.java:769)
        at Client.packetProcess(Client.java:720)
        at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:196)
        at Server.main(Server.java:50)
Could not save for tester

that’s what it says when I log out of an account on the run.bat

item.title: I require help. x blitz x, I reposted!
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“x blitz x, post:6, topic:234295”]Remove the Build DIR, the Build.xml and replace the run.bat code with

@echo off
cls
title Run Server
CD .\French Asult\
"C:\program files\java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe" *.java
java Server
pause

Oh and move the Config DIR into the Frech Asult DIR[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: I require help. x blitz x, I reposted!

item.title: I require help. x blitz x, I reposted!
item.dc:creator: @99skiller99 99skiller99
item.description:
@99skiller99 wrote:

I get this error but it still says the server is online.

config/npcs/npc.cfg: file not found.
java.io.FileNotFoundException: config\CFG\items.dat (The system cannot find the
path specified)
        at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method)
        at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at ItemHandler.loadItemList(ItemHandler.java:193)
        at ItemHandler.<init>(ItemHandler.java:22)
        at Server.main(Server.java:31)
Starting server on 0.0.0.0:43594

but that file is in there, I just checked.

Read full topic

item.title: I require help. x blitz x, I reposted!
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

Remove the Build DIR, the Build.xml and replace the run.bat code with

@echo off
cls
title Run Server
CD .\French Asult\
"C:\program files\java\jdk1.6.0_07\bin\javac.exe" *.java
java Server
pause

Oh and move the Config DIR into the Frech Asult DIR

Read full topic
